pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [60372c64c6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18845/commits/60372c64c62f2ce0f3dc63250b1e3e885c5b6783)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.UniversallyInjective`|1892|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsStableUnderBaseChange.isomorphisms`
`+ Scheme.Hom.injective`
`+ UniversallyClosed.of_comp_surjective`
`+ UniversallyInjective`
`+ UniversallyInjective.iff_diagonal`
`+ UniversallyInjective.isStableUnderBaseChange`
`+ UniversallyInjective.respectsIso`
`+ diagonal_isomorphisms`
`+ injective_isStableUnderComposition`
`+ instance (priority := 900) [Mono f] : UniversallyInjective f`
`+ instance : IsLocalAtTarget (monomorphisms Scheme)`
`+ instance : MorphismProperty.IsMultiplicative @UniversallyInjective`
`+ instance : MorphismProperty.IsStableUnderBaseChange @Surjective := by`
`+ isIso_diagonal_iff`
`+ of_comp_surjective`
`+ universallyInjective_eq`
`+ universallyInjective_eq_diagonal`
`+ universallyInjective_isLocalAtTarget`
`+ universallyInjective_isStableUnderComposition`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
</details>

Regarding the large-import, it might be worth investigating whether the imports of `PullbackCarrier.lean` (the newly imported file) can be reduced. But on the other hand `PullbackCarrier.lean` is definitely a basic file for algebraic geometry so I don't think it's a problem to import it freely.

Thanks

maintainer merge

bors r-

bors d+

:v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
I agree that we should treat `PullbackCarrier` as a basic file that may be imported freely. It is still worth to try reducing the imports, but I think it is fine to do this in a different PR.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
# Universally injective morphism

A morphism of schemes `f : X âŸ¶ Y` is universally injective if `X Ã—[Y] Y' âŸ¶ Y'` is injective
```

```suggestion
for all base changes `Y' âŸ¶ Y`. This is equivalent to the diagonal morphism being surjective
```
I would even prefer `for all morphisms ...`
Is there a rule on fields named `out`? In this case, the class name is descriptive enough I suppose.
I've renamed it.
This should go to `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.UnderlyingMap`.

```suggestion
theorem UniversallyInjective.respectsIso : RespectsIso @UniversallyInjective :=
  universallyInjective_eq_diagonal.symm â–¸ inferInstance
```
Should we converge to this naming scheme for these instances?
Could you add a lemma `injective_of_universallyInjective`?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): universally injective morphisms
